sources.title: Flowers In The Attic (1987)
sources.description: Flowers in the Attic is a 1987 American psychological horror film directed by Jeffrey Bloom and starring Louise Fletcher, Victoria Tennant, Kristy Swanson, and Jeb Stuart Adams. It  follows the story of four siblings—Chris, Cathy, and twins Cory and Carrie—who are forced to live with their abusive grandmother after their father's death. Confined to an attic and subjected to neglect and cruelty, they struggle to survive while uncovering dark family secrets, including the incestuous nature of their parents' relationship.

metadata.Plot: Dreams of an inheritance turn into a nightmare for four innocent children. Locked in the deserted north wing of the family mansion. Beaten by a vicious grandmother. Tormented by a menacing caretaker. Starved and left alone to wither - and perhaps die - like FLOWERS IN THE ATTIC. Their only hope lies in escape. But a horrible truth awaits them in the main house - a truth that will push the children toward a dizzying and violent solution. FLOWERS IN THE ATTIC - living proof that even the prettiest flowers can grow deadly in the attic's darkness.
metadata.Actors: Louise Fletcher, Victoria Tennant, Kristy Swanson
